name: Avoid having applications with the debug mode activated
description: Checks for the Debug flag enabled in Dot Net application.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in config file
rationale:
Attackers can leverage the additional information they gain from debugging output to mount attacks targeted on the framework, database, or other resources used by the application.

Failure frequently compromises all data that should have been protected. Typically, this information includes sensitive personal information (PII) data such as health records, credentials, personal data, and credit cards, which often require protection as defined by laws or regulations such as the EU GDPR or local privacy laws.
reference:
CWE-11 http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/11.html

OWASP Top 10 2004 -A10-Insecure Configuration Management
OWASP Top 10 2007 -A6-Information Leakage and Improper Error Handling
OWASP Top 10 2010 -A6-Security Misconfiguration
OWASP Top 10 2013 -A5-Security Misconfiguration
OWASP Top 10 2017 -A6-Security Misconfiguration
remediation: Review the web config file and update the value of debug property to false
alternativeName: Ensure you have reviewed the web config file and update the value of debug property to false
